name: Fairfield Inn New York LaGuardia Airport / Astoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights for the opening days of the Open, arrived several days before Hurricane Irene. Enjoyed our stay and will stay here again if visiting the Open.
reviews.title: Great hotel for visiting the US Open (tennis)

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Quite a pleasant surprise

reviews.text: --very friendly and helpful front desk staff
reviews.title: Great Hotel and We'll Definitely Be Back

reviews.text: --SCHEDULED (hourly) free shuttle to and from the US open from 9 am to 1am--still require a ten minute walk to get to the gate but very reasonable to avoid the crowded traffic if they dropped off closer.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location. Exceeded my expectations.

reviews.text: --comfortable, clean room with fridge and microwave
reviews.title: Best little hotel in the area

reviews.text: When I go to New York, finding a hotel is always a problem- good location, cleanliness and no bugs are always hard to find in one hotel. When we booked Fairfield Inn Astoria I had low expectations but when we got there we had good service- friendly shuttle bus driver (Michael) and helpful staff. The rooms were very clean and the free breakfast was unexpectedly good.
reviews.title: A hotel beyond expectations

reviews.text: To be honest: despite quite positive reviews on Tripadvisor I did not expect much. One automatically adjust expectations when it comes to NYC hotels and the hotel airports are usually not among tier-1 properties.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Let's start with the bad news. If there is no free shuttle to LGA airport the hotel would not qualify as airport hotel because it is quite distant ... definitely not "across the street from the airport". On top of that the hotel is in middle of nowhere. There is no restaurant nearby (except Burger King and Dunkin 'Donuts on the other side of the highway’, no entertainment - except a fantastic classic car dealership just next to the hotel with many old Rolls Royces, Ferraris, american flagships of the 1950s ... which is nice to walk through but not when one gets hungry. The mostly commercial neighborhood is not an area I would feel comfortable to walk at night.
reviews.title: Good choice for NY

reviews.text: But the hotel itself was a pleasant surprise. Clean and well maintained rooms, very nice staff, reasonable breakfast and a free internet with a decent speed. Everything was in a good working condition.
reviews.title: A bargain; Astoria is wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not a big fan of airport hotels but if I need to spend again a night close to La Guardia airport I would not look for another hotel. Fairfield Inn LGA Astoria exceeded my expectations and I would not hesitate to book another night there although I am sure there are cheaper hotels close to LGA airport.
reviews.title: Great place to stay....highly recommended!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. Check in is so smooth, staffs are friendly, breakfast is great (I've seen worst). Though location is away from Manhattan but you can go anywhere from here by subway/train. Just plan ahead and buying the metrocard really save time. I definitely come to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.text: Loved it and would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good rooms and good service.

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past year (and will be visiting again in June). It is convenient to NYC - and also has free parking!
reviews.title: Family 4th vacation

reviews.text: The rooms are very small and have no view, but they are clean and nicely appointed. We generally just need a clean place to sleep when we are in town, and this place does the trick. The free wifi and breakfast is also a nice touch. I highly recommend this place for people on a budget who don't need a lot of frills!
reviews.title: Excellent location for attending US Open tennis
